adrFormatAddress: 190 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Intimate hangout with a lounge vibe & sidewalk tables serving American fare & drinks until late.

originalText.text:
Service is spectacular! It's a hidden gem much larger than appears. The chicken quesadilla is my fav. Brunch offerings are well priced and tasty!
I love to sit outside and watch Chelsea go by!

text.text:
Service is spectacular! It's a hidden gem much larger than appears. The chicken quesadilla is my fav. Brunch offerings are well priced and tasty!
I love to sit outside and watch Chelsea go by!

originalText.text:
My friend invited me to have dinner with him after going to an exhibit at the FIT museum. We sat outside and enjoyed a delicious meal at Merchants.

American fare, the menu essentially featured elevated pub dishes. We ordered the cheesy truffle potato wedges (although I didn't taste any truffle flavor. Maybe it was in the bacon aioli? I don't eat pork so I requested a Sriracha aioli instead.), avocado fries and carne asada tacos.

For dessert we ordered the sour cream apple walnut pie which comes from the Little Pie company. If you've never had this before, don't walk, run and try it.

To wash everything down, we ordered two cocktails: spiked lemonade and the southern bourbon peach tea. Although the spiked lemonade was good, I found the southern bourbon peach tea to be bitter. It was basically unsweetened peach iced tea with bourbon. I enjoy bourbon. However this was not my idea of a tasty cocktail.

Overall the food was high quality and the service was good.

originalText.text: We came for brunch last weekend and I'm giving it a solid 4.  Our server was lovely but didn't come back and check on us once food had arrived. I had to ask another staff member to find her to order another margarita.  Nachos we're supposed to have chili beef but couldn't see nor taste beef only beans. Eggs Benedict was pretty good. Would go back but a 4 not a 5.

I had to ask another staff member to find her to order another margarita.  Nachos we're supposed to have chili beef but couldn't see nor taste beef only beans. Eggs Benedict was pretty good. Would go back but a 4 not a 5.

originalText.text:
I had the cheesebuger. It was fantastic, the burger was cooked so well (medium) and tasty. My friend had the pasta and said that was delicious too.
Service was excellent, prices were reasonable for NYC. Would not hesitate to go back there again when I'm in New York next.

text.text:

Service was excellent, prices were reasonable for NYC. Would not hesitate to go back there again when I'm in New York next.

originalText.text: Sat at the bar last night (pleasantly crowded for 10p on St. Patrick’s) and had some really surprisingly good cocktails for not-a-stuffy-exclusive-hidden-under-the-ground-with-a-password cocktail bar. The strawberry Negroni was my favorite - a very slightly sweet, springy, tingly, effervescent twist on my go-to cocktail… and there’s a real strawberry inside of the ice cube! We had to order two of these and I’ll be back for another two to show my bartender partner. The blackberry bramble was deliciously herbal and even less sweet than the Negroni. I loved the spicy kick and the salt rim on what looks like it’s going to be a whole smoothie. I love surprise contradictions in food and drink :) And finally the Chelsea Star with passion fruit purée and whole side of Prosecco took me home with its mouth watering tartness. I don’t usually go for fruity cocktails but these managed to bring out the nuances of fruit flavor without drowning them out in a cloying dose simple syrup. And the bartender was very nice, informative, and made everything expertly!
